courses.name: Beginning Ceramics
courses.description: Exploration of ceramic art as an expressive, communicative medium. Study of ceramic design, technique and historic and contemporary models within the context of the creative process. Group critiques, slides, demonstrations. Expendable materials fee.

courses.name: Intermediate Ceramics
courses.description: Continuation of ART_CERM 2100 with emphasis on wheel throwing and the vessel format. Further exploration of glazing and firing techniques. Group and individual critiques, demonstrations, slide lectures and visiting artists. Expendable materials fee.

courses.name: Advanced Ceramics
courses.description: Continuation of ART_CERM 3100. Includes advanced problems in firing, clay and glaze technology, forming and ornamentation. Payment of expendable materials fee required.  May be repeated to 15 hours maximum.

courses.name: Ceramics Sculpture
courses.description: Sculptural forms constructed of slabs, coils and wheel-thrown elements. Payment of expendable materials expense is required. May be repeated to 15 hours maximum.

courses.name: Graduate Ceramics
courses.description: Advanced study of ceramic technology and design concepts with emphasis on directed development of individual work. Payment of expendable materials expense is required. May be repeated to 18 hours maximum.

courses.name: Graduate Ceramic Sculpture
courses.description: Directed development of individual work. Payment of expendable materials expense is required. May be repeated to 18 hours maximum.

courses.name: Problems in Ceramics
courses.prerequisites: ART_CERM 7100 and ART_CERM 7110 and departmental consent

courses.name: Graduate Ceramics II
courses.description: Continuation of ART_CERM 7100.  Repeatable to 15 hours.
